title: [K-12] STEM-Integrated Comparative Problem-Solving Learning Design: Application of Language Analysis-Based Hypothetical Learning Trajectories (HLT) and Design for Teaching and Learning Research (DDR)

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational STEM concepts, mastery of comparative analysis methodologies, text structure analysis and vocabulary application skills, and basic writing/reading comprehension abilities
context.additional_context: Blended learning combining digital/analog activities in a BYOD environment, emphasizing collaborative problem-solving through group work, with language support tools (grammar checkers, vocabulary expansion tools) to enhance learners' writing, speaking, and listening skills

learning_goals: Learners will design hypothetical learning trajectories (HLT) for comparative problem-solving in STEM-integrated environments, integrating scientific inquiry processes with linguistic expressions (grammar, vocabulary, text structure).
Using design-based research (DBR) methodologies, learners will iteratively improve learning activities and provide clear text-based feedback (writing/reading) during problem-solving processes.

Learners will systematically solve real-world problems through quantitative/qualitative comparative analysis and present results via structured reports (writing) or oral presentations (speaking/expression).

resources: Online Collaboration Tools (Padlet, Google Workspace, etc.)
Digital Assessment Platforms (Quizlet, Google Forms, etc.)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
